original: chung dus kyang stong pa nyid kyi sgom pa med par rdo rje'i gur gyi dbus kho na la /
analyzed: chung dus kyang stong pa nyid kyi sgom pa med par rdo rje'i gur gyi dbus kho na la /
translated: Even the small nada should be abandoned in the center of the vajra tent without meditating on emptiness.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin chos 'byung ae yig gi rnam pa steng yangs pa 'og phra ba'i rnam par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin chos 'byung ae yig gi rnam pa steng yangs pa 'og phra ba'i rnam par bsgoms nas /
translated: The nature of the realm of phenomena is the form of the syllable E, the source of phenomena, meditated on as wide at the top and narrow at the bottom.

original: dbus su gzhal yas khang @290a * //
analyzed: dbus su gzhal yas khang @290a * //
translated: In the middle of that, one should meditate on the celestial mansion.

original: sgom par byed pa ni kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: sgom par byed pa ni kha cig gi'o //

original: de'i rjes su stong pa nyid las ldang ba'i rnal 'byor gyis bhee ram ba rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim pas sna tshogs rdo rje mngon par rdzogs par byas nas /

analyzed: de'i steng du sna tshogs padma bsgom ste de'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ;

analyzed: dbang ldan mtshams su mthing ga'o // de'i lte bar a'a li k'a li las byung ba'i zhes pa ni g-yon dang g-yas skor du gnas pa'i a'a li g'a li'i phreng ba yongs su gyur pa las ;

analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin zla ba dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyi ma dag gi ngos phrad pa bde ba chen po kha sbyar ba'i dbus su h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i lte ba'i nang du nyi ma la gnas pa'i sa bon h'um so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang

translated: Again, all the accomplished heroes and yoginƒ´s and so on dwelling in the ten directions are caused to melt by the nature of the gnosis of performing activities through the union of the experience of wisdom and method and are caused to enter.

analyzed: spyan gsum pa phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa g-yas su bsnyes pa'o ;

analyzed: dur khrod ni sdug bsngal dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dgra rnams la bde ba'i mngon par zhen pa dang / rtag pa rgyu med pa rgyu mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa dang / 'khor pa la mngon par zhen pa'am ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa zad mi shes pa'i mngon par zhen pa /
translated: The charnel ground is the exhaustion of the ten kinds of clinging: clinging to happiness in the face of the enemies of suffering, impermanence, and so forth; clinging to permanence, causelessness, discordant causes, and so forth; clinging to cyclic existence or to what is not real;

original: skye ba'i mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: skye ba'i mngon par zhen pa /

original: bdag la mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: bdag la mngon par zhen pa /

original: de'i rjes su 'gro @291a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro @291a * //
translated: clinging to what follows from that;

analyzed: ba'i mngon par zhen pa / de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pa /

translated: The ten directions should be understood as the ten lords of the directions, such as Indra, who are purified of these ten.

translated: The eight charnel grounds are the eight channels through which the wisdom fire of fierce inner heat moves upward, and by which the Tathagatas are made invisible in the wheel of dharma.

original: de bas na gzhan du gsungs pa dur khrod ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'dus pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi bdag med pa'i rang bzhin gyis brgyad do //

translated: Therefore, the charnel grounds mentioned elsewhere are the eight kinds of selflessness of the eight consciousnesses that comprise the entire world system.

analyzed: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi yon tan de dang de'i rnam par dag pas mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The

translated: The four faces are blue, black, green, red, and yellow, in the east, north, and so on, respectively.

analyzed: mngon par @291b 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //

translated: The twelve means that he has twelve eyes because he stops the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: re re la spyan gsum pa zhes pa ni dus gsum rnam pa thams cad kyi sgo nas gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re la spyan gsum pa zhes pa ni dus gsum rnam pa thams cad kyi sgo nas gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Each face has three eyes because he sees the three times in every way.

original: brkyang dang bskum pa'i zhabs zhes pa ni 'gro ba thams cad stong pa nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ngo //
analyzed: brkyang dang bskum pa'i zhabs zhes pa ni 'gro ba thams cad stong pa nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ngo //
translated: His feet are in the posture of someone who is striding forward and striding back because he includes all beings with emptiness.

original: de yang zhabs g-yon pa bskum pa las mtho lngar g-yas brkyang pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang zhabs g-yon pa bskum pa las mtho lngar g-yas brkyang pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, the left foot is bent, and the right is extended five cubits.

original: de kho nar phyag gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: de kho nar phyag gnyis kyis so //
translated: With both hands, he is just so.

original: stong pa dang snying rje dag ro gcig pa'i phyir g-yas pa'i rdo rje ni ye shes la ro mnyam pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa dang snying rje dag ro gcig pa'i phyir g-yas pa'i rdo rje ni ye shes la ro mnyam pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The right vajra is the nature of the equality of taste with intuition, because of the oneness of taste of emptiness and compassion.

original: g-yon na dril bu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩgti mug la sogs pa ni 'gro ba'i gti mug rnam par nyams par byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: g-yon na dril bu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin no // gti mug la sogs pa ni 'gro ba'i gti mug rnam par nyams par byas pa'i phyir /
translated: The left bell is the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dkar po gti mug gi rang bzhin khrag dang bcas pa brgyangs pa rang gi rgyab tu 'dzin pa'o ;
analyzed: dkar po gti mug gi rang bzhin khrag dang bcas pa brgyangs pa rang gi rgyab tu 'dzin pa'o ;
translated: The white skull cup, which is the nature of delusion, is filled with blood, and he holds it to his back, in order to destroy the delusion of the world.

original: /da ma rul sogs pa ni g-yas pa'i gong ma thog mar byas nas de bzhin du g-yon pa'i steng yang thog mar byas nas kha tv'am ga la sogs pa rim pas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: /da ma rul sogs pa ni g-yas pa'i gong ma thog mar byas nas de bzhin du g-yon pa'i steng yang thog mar byas nas kha tv'am ga la sogs pa rim pas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The damaru and so on are held in order, beginning with the upper right hand, and beginning with the upper left hand, the khatvanga and so on.

original: de la mchog tu dga' ba'i sgras sangs rgyas thams cad bskul ba ni da ma ru'o //
analyzed: de la mchog tu dga' ba'i sgras sangs rgyas thams cad bskul ba ni da ma ru'o //
translated: The damaru is the summoning of all the Buddhas with the sound of supreme joy.

original: lus ngag yid gsum gyi skyon gcod par byed pas dgra sta'o //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum gyi skyon gcod par byed pas dgra sta'o //
translated: Since it cuts the faults of body, speech, and mind, it is the sword.

original: dngos dang dngos min gyi rnam par rtog pa gcod par byed pa'i shes rab ni gri gug go //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos min gyi rnam par rtog pa gcod par byed pa'i shes rab ni gri gug go //
translated: The wisdom that cuts the concepts of entity and non-entity is the flaying knife.

original: srid pa gsum gyi nyon mongs pa dral bar byed pas rtse gsum bsgreng ba byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin dkar po dang / sku gsung thugs rnam par dag pas dkar po dmar po nag po'i mgo bo gsum dang ldan pa'i kha tv'am ga'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi nyon mongs pa dral bar byed pas rtse gsum bsgreng ba byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin dkar po dang / sku gsung thugs rnam par dag pas dkar po dmar po nag po'i mgo bo gsum dang ldan pa'i kha tv'am ga'o //
translated: Since it cuts the afflictions of the three existences, the erect trident is the nature of bodhicitta, white, and the three heads, white, red, and black, are the nature of the pure body, speech, and mind.

original: bde ba chen po dang snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin thod pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po dang snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin thod pa'o //
translated: The skull cup is the nature of great bliss and great compassion.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par bcings pas srung ba ni rdo rje'i zhags pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par bcings pas srung ba ni rdo rje'i zhags pa'o //
translated: The protection bound with the rope of pure gnosis is the vajra noose.

original: dngos dang dngos min gyi rnam rtog nyams pa dang thar pa'i rang bzhin tshangs pa'i mgo bo'o //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos min gyi rnam rtog nyams pa dang thar pa'i rang bzhin tshangs pa'i mgo bo'o //
translated: The head of BrahmƒÅ, the nature of the destruction of the concepts of entity and non-entity and liberation, is the head.

original: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub kyi sems rgyun g-yon ngos su 'bar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub kyi sems rgyun g-yon ngos su 'bar ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the bodhicitta dhƒÅtu is blazing on the left side of the BhagavƒÅn,

original: dbu la cung zad g-yon du yo ba'i zla ba phyed pa'o //üîΩchos kyi dbyings las kun nas slong ba nyid kyi phyir dbu la thod pa lnga'i phreng ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi don byed @292a * //
analyzed: dbu la cung zad g-yon du yo ba'i zla ba phyed pa'o // chos kyi dbyings las kun nas slong ba nyid kyi phyir dbu la thod pa lnga'i phreng ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi don byed @292a * //
translated: On his head is a half-moon slightly tilted to the left.üîΩOn his head is a garland of five skulls, because he is the universal ground of the realm of reality.

original: pa'i phyir sna tshogs rdo rje dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir sna tshogs rdo rje dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He has a crossed vajra, because he acts for the welfare of all beings.

original: bdud bzhi rnam par nyams pa'i phyir dbu la ral ba'i thor cog go //
analyzed: bdud bzhi rnam par nyams pa'i phyir dbu la ral ba'i thor cog go //
translated: On his head is a topknot of hair, because he has overcome the four demons.

original: blo ldan la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang / lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgoms pa'i dga' ba dang sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: blo ldan la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang / lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgoms pa'i dga' ba dang sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: The wise and so forth are the five transcendent ones and the nature of the four goddesses, because he is the joy and union of the cultivation of serenity and insight.üîΩHe has the nine expressions of dance:

original: sgeg dang dpa' ba mi sdug pa /üîΩdregs dang bzhad mdzad 'jigs su rung //
analyzed: sgeg dang dpa' ba mi sdug pa / dregs dang bzhad mdzad 'jigs su rung //
translated: graceful, heroic, ugly,üîΩarrogant, laughing, terrifying,

original: snying rje rngam ba zhi rnams kyi //üîΩgar gyi nyams dgur ldan pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje rngam ba zhi rnams kyi // gar gyi nyams dgur ldan pa'o //
translated: pitiful, fierce, and peaceful.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can no //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can no //
translated: He wears a tiger-skin skirt, because he is free of the stains of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: a'a li k'a li lnga bcu rnam par dag pas mi mgo khrag dang bcas pa gang gis do shal du 'dzin pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li lnga bcu rnam par dag pas mi mgo khrag dang bcas pa gang gis do shal du 'dzin pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: He holds a garland of fifty pure a-li-ka-li heads with blood, just as it is.

original: mgul rgyan dang gdu bu snyan rgyan spyi gtsug gi nor bu dang mi'i rgyus pa'i tshangs skud dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mgul rgyan dang gdu bu snyan rgyan spyi gtsug gi nor bu dang mi'i rgyus pa'i tshangs skud dang ldan pa /
translated: He has a necklace, bracelets, earrings, a crown jewel, and a human-bone sacred thread.

original: lus thams cad byang chub kyi sems kyis khyab pas lus thams cad la thal pas byugs pa'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad byang chub kyi sems kyis khyab pas lus thams cad la thal pas byugs pa'o //
translated: His entire body is smeared with ashes, his entire body is pervaded with bodhicitta.

original: mdun nas zhes pa ni 'khyud nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mdun nas zhes pa ni 'khyud nas gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn front‚Äù means embracing.

original: zla mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyir nyi ma la gnas pa dang nyi ma'i 'od zer can no //
analyzed: zla mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyir nyi ma la gnas pa dang nyi ma'i 'od zer can no //
translated: He is ‚Äústanding in the sun‚Äù because he has menstrual blood, and he is ‚Äúhaving the luster of the sun‚Äù because he is free from passion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir thod pa skam po'i phreng ba 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir thod pa skam po'i phreng ba 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a garland of dry skulls because he is free from passion.

original: bdud khrag la sogs pa ni 'khyud pa'i phyag g-yon pas 'dzin pa'i thod pa las 'dzag pa'i khrag gi rgyun gyis rje btsun la stob pa //
analyzed: bdud khrag la sogs pa ni 'khyud pa'i phyag g-yon pas 'dzin pa'i thod pa las 'dzag pa'i khrag gi rgyun gyis rje btsun la stob pa //
translated: The blood and so on of the mƒÅras flow from the skull cup held in his left embracing arm and are offered to the venerable one.

original: 'jigs byed ces bya ba ni gyen du bsgreng ba'i g-yas pa sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i rdo rjes phyogs bcur gnas pa'i gdug pa'i sems can yang dag par 'jigs par byed pa'o //

original: bskal pa'i me ltar zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gro ba la mi dmigs pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa'i me ltar zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gro ba la mi dmigs pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Like the fire at the end of the eon means that by emptiness, one is impartial toward beings, because of nonapprehending.

analyzed: gzi brjid che ba yang rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyis gsal bar sbyor ba'i phyir /

analyzed: khrag ces pa ni zla mtshan dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Blood means that one is endowed with the menstrual flow.

original: brla gnyis la ni bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
analyzed: brla gnyis la ni bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //

original: bde chen zhes pa ni lhag mthong gi tshul gyis bde ba chen po la sim na yang 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde chen zhes pa ni lhag mthong gi tshul gyis bde ba chen po la sim na yang 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //

original: cung zad dgod dang yongs su 'khyud //
analyzed: cung zad dgod dang yongs su 'khyud //
translated: Slight laughter and full embrace,

original: gcer bu nyid dang skra grol ma //
analyzed: gcer bu nyid dang skra grol ma //
translated: nakedness and loose hair,

original: spu ldang ba dang bde chen po'i //
analyzed: spu ldang ba dang bde chen po'i //
translated: goose bumps and great bliss,

original: phyi rol du ni rtags lnga'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni rtags lnga'o //

original: dngos su rtags gsum brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos su rtags gsum brjod pa'i phyir //

original: de la rtags gnyis rtogs par bya //
analyzed: de la rtags gnyis rtogs par bya //

original: 'khor lo lnga gnas lha mo rnams //
analyzed: 'khor lo lnga gnas lha mo rnams //

analyzed: @292b rtags lnga po la yang dag gnas //

original: mgrin pa'i 'khor lor ngal bso te //
